com.werdpressed.partisan.rundo

Class SubtractStrings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.werdpressed.partisan.rundo.SubtractStrings

  • public class SubtractStrings
extends java.lang.Object
    Compares two String objects and returns the first and last points they deviate from one another, subStrings between the two, and information on whether or not text has been added, replaced or deleted.

    • Constructor Summary

      Default constructor
      SubtractStrings(java.lang.String oldText, java.lang.String newText)
      Contains the two Strings to be compared.

      • SubtractStrings

        public SubtractStrings()
        Default constructor

      • SubtractStrings

        public SubtractStrings(java.lang.String oldText,
               java.lang.String newText)
        Contains the two Strings to be compared.

        The order of the arguments determines the results of certain methods (i.e. if oldText is empty, but newText populated, the change will be regarded as an ADDITION rather than DELETION)
        Parameters:
        oldText - Old Text to compare.
        newText - New Text to compare.

    • Method Detail

      • findAlteredTextInContext

        public java.lang.String findAlteredTextInContext(char[] oldText,
                                        char[] newText)
        Calculates the difference between the two arguments, and returns a subString based on whether or not text has been added, deleted or replaced. If text has been replaced, this method will always return a subString from the newText parameter.
        Parameters:
        oldText - Old Text
        newText - New Text
        Returns:
        subString of newText if text has been replaced, or a subString of either oldText or newText if an addition or deletion has occured.
        See Also:
        findAlteredText(char[], char[]), findAlteredText(String, String)

      • findAlteredText

        public java.lang.String findAlteredText(char[] oldText,
                               char[] newText)
        See Also:
        findAlteredText(char[], char[])

      • findAlteredText

        public java.lang.String findAlteredText(java.lang.String oldText,
                               java.lang.String newText)
        Calculates first and last deviation points between oldText and newText, accounts for offsets, assigns an SubtractStrings.AlterationType to alterationType and returns a subString between the two deviation points.

        Unlike findAlteredTextInContext(char[], char[]), this method will always return a subString of the larger of the two argumens.
        Parameters:
        oldText - Old Text to compare.
        newText - New Text to compare.
        Returns:
        subString of the larger of the two arguments, between firstDeviation and lastDeviation

      • findReplacedText

        public java.lang.String findReplacedText(com.werdpressed.partisan.rundo.SubtractStrings.AlterationType altType,
                                char[] oldText,
                                char[] newText)
        Complements findAlteredText(String, String) by calculating the subString for the smaller of oldText.length and newText.length.

        Requires findAlteredText(String, String) to be called first.

        Requires an SubtractStrings.AlterationType argument, else method will return null
        Parameters:
        altType - Must be of SubtractStrings.AlterationType REPLACEMENT
        oldText - Old Text to compare.
        newText - New Text to compare.
        Returns:
        subString of the smaller of oldText or newText between firstDeviation and lastDeviation if SubtractStrings.AlterationType is REPLACEMENT. If SubtractStrings.AlterationType is not REPLACEMENT, this method will return null

      • findReplacedText

        public java.lang.String findReplacedText(com.werdpressed.partisan.rundo.SubtractStrings.AlterationType altType,
                                java.lang.String oldTextString,
                                java.lang.String newTextString)
        See Also:
        findReplacedText(AlterationType, char[], char[])

      • getLastDeviation

        public int getLastDeviation()
        Returns lastDeviation value
        Returns:
        lastDeviation This marks the last point of deviation at the end of the longer of the two compared Strings

      • getAlterationType

        public com.werdpressed.partisan.rundo.SubtractStrings.AlterationType getAlterationType()
        Get alterationType value.
        Returns:
        lastAlterationType value. Specifies whether the new text replaced, added to or deleted from the old text during the last comparison.
